data.title: For Honor
data.statement:
"For Honor" is a video game with a pretty realistic fight system. Your opponent can hit from right, from left or from above. You can repulse his attack if you hit at the same side. If he does the hard hit, you can only turn in the opposite direction.
Your task is make a program that get 2 lines (type of attack and side when your opponent try to hit) and return also 2 lines (what you must to do and when you must do it)

Table with all information:
```
    Your opponent's       |          Your
 power | attack direction | response | response direction 
-------+------------------+----------+--------------------
 usual | left/right/above |  defence | left/right/above
       |                  |          | (same as your
       |                  |          |  opponent)
-------+------------------+----------+--------------------
 hard  | left             |  dodging | right
       |------------------|          |--------------------
       | right            |          | left
       |------------------|          |--------------------
       | above            |          | any
```

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

"For Honor" is a video game with a pretty realistic fight system. Your opponent can hit from right, from left or from above. You can repulse his attack if you hit at the same side. If he does the hard hit, you can only turn in the opposite direction.
Your task is make a program that get 2 lines (type of attack and side when your opponent try to hit) and return also 2 lines (what you must to do and when you must do it)

Table with all information:

    Your opponent's       |          Your
 power | attack direction | response | response direction 
-------+------------------+----------+--------------------
 usual | left/right/above |  defence | left/right/above
       |                  |          | (same as your
       |                  |          |  opponent)
-------+------------------+----------+--------------------
 hard  | left             |  dodging | right
       |------------------|          |--------------------
       | right            |          | left
       |------------------|          |--------------------
       | above            |          | any





   

      
Input

      
Line 1: A string POWER for your opponent's power (usual/hard)
Line 2: A string SIDE for your opponent's attack direction (left/right/above)

   

   

      
Output

      
Line 1: Your response (defence/dodging)
Line 2: Your response direction (left/right/above/any)

   

   

      
Constraints

      

   

   

      
Example

      

         

            
Input

            
usual
above

         

         

            
Output

            
defence
above
